channel.title: Things You May Want to Copy
channel.description:
So I spent hours upon hours working on this Powerpoint, and I finally have it done. It is a collection of things you may want to copy and paste into your journal. It includes a Journal guide to all BD classes and a numbered list of 16. This is probably going to be expanded upon. If you have any suggestions for me to add something to it, please contact me on Discord (Asew54321#6797).
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1hyr26Trd62lof60I6G2d_RNwl-N3tmXJFpbgPOUDsO4/edit?usp=sharing

item.title: Things You May Want to Copy
item.dc:creator: Asew54321
item.description:
TryphonX:

https://i.imgur.com/XtgVGXY.gifv

Observer identifies as a Knight?

Yes, didn’t you know? If you’re not accepting of that, then you’re just a racist pig!
(gonna change it after I make this post tho)

RopeStringFace:

For observer I do the following log eah night

N1: Follow (x)
Visited
Visited by

For example:

N1: follow 5
visted no one
visited by 6 and 3

…but I have that down already? Reread the Obs slide. The only reason why all nights aren’t formatted like this is because of Window Peak.

Read full topic
item.source: Things You May Want to Copy

item.title: Things You May Want to Copy
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
For observer I do the following log each night

N1: Follow (x)
Visited
Visited by

For example:

N1: follow 5
visted no one
visited by 6 and 3

item.title: Things You May Want to Copy
item.dc:creator: Asew54321
item.description:
“MOHR: Because [bad words] were mostly religious in the Middle Ages, any part of God’s body you could curse with. God’s bones, nails, wounds, precious heart, passion, God’s death—that was supposedly one of Queen Elizabeth I’s favorite oaths.”

Read full topic
item.source: Things You May Want to Copy

item.title: Things You May Want to Copy
item.dc:creator: Dooku
item.description:
Asew54321:

anything concerning God’s body parts was considered a curse.

Is death a body part now? I need to get out from under this rock more often it seems O.O

Read full topic
item.source: Things You May Want to Copy

item.title: Things You May Want to Copy
item.dc:creator: Asew54321
item.description:
ngl I looked up “curses during the middle ages” and the first result said that anything concerning God’s body parts was considered a curse. I chose that because it sounded edgy.

Read full topic
item.source: Things You May Want to Copy
